metadata.title: CVE-2018-16375 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. Missing checks forheader_info.height and header_info.width in the function pnmtoimage inbin/jpwl/convert.c can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1').
